website_summaries.verdict: You would be had-pressed to find a more cost-effective method to give a desktop or laptop PC an all-around performance boost.
pros: Available in an array of sizes
Effective way to improve a PC’s overall speed
cons: Fits most, but not all PCs

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my Dell 8930 from 16GB to 32GB. This was a well-reviewed product and their website was helpful ordering the correct part. Came in as expected, installed in about 4 minutes, immediately recognized by system, and has been terrific. Only been in about 3 weeks so can't speak to durability yet, but I have seen one (1) RAM chip failure in 32 years of computing, so we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: J. Labonte

customer_reviews.title: Easy upgrade for Dell 3670 desktop.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my new Dell Inspirion 3670 desktop i5 PC from 8GB to 16GB. Now running dual channel with noticeable increase in speed. Delivery and packaging was excellent. Easy to install and tested to be free of errors. This Crucial 8GB matched well with the 8GB module by Kingston that came pre-installed in the PC
customer_reviews.author: PugPower

customer_reviews.title: Always loved crucial but this is misleading. 100% NON ECC
customer_reviews.text: Crucial has always been my go-to but this product description is misleading. "Description CT2K16G4DFD8266 is a 32GB Kit consisting of (2) 16GB DDR4 desktop modules that operates at speeds up to 2666 MT/s and has a CL19 latency. It is an Unbuffered DIMM. It conforms to the industry standard DDR4 ECC UDIMM layout of 288 pins and is compatible with systems that take DDR4 2666MT/s UDIMM memory." This does NOT conform with ECC standards for one second. I will add that on crucial's website the product is marketed correctly and clearly states NON ECC
customer_reviews.author: TylerT

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Got a single memory card to install in my Lenovo 7h Gen i5 PC. The PC originally came with 8GB, and had one memory slot open. The price for this 16GB card is almost $10 less than if I had bought it directly from Crucial. Thanks to Amazon Prime it arrived in a day, in a basic plastic container that nonetheless protected it well. The Fit was perfect, and now my PC has 24GB of memory, and the improvement has been drastic. I do a lot of photo editing of large RAW files from my camera, the extra memory has sped up operations considerably. The motherboard recognized the memory immediately and so did Windows, literally no issues whatsoever. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Zero issues for me!
customer_reviews.text: Crucial is a trusted brand in RAM, and this was close to the lowest price for the amount of RAM at the time ($120 for 32gb). The other RAM sticks that have the fancy heat sinks aren’t necessary unless you’re doing some serious overclocking for long periods of time, and even then if you’re doing that, you probably have a good amount of cooling fans in your PC. So these basic, not pretty chips do the job. I built a Hackintosh and have had zero issues since my purchase 2 months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Rad AstronautTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Dell XPS 8920
customer_reviews.text: Using the crucial website this was the kit suggested as compatible. Reading everything thoroughly it appears that it should plug and play but upon installation the computer will not post. Have tried different arrangements of sticks singularly and collectively. When these are in any of the slots the computer will not boot. Immediately upon starting I'm met with a flashing amber light indicating bad memory according to the Dell manual. Waste of time and money. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Non-XMP memory
customer_reviews.text: This is just typical OEM DDR4 (288pin) memory. It does not have an XMP profile. It works with my existing OEM memory (DELL), which also does not have an XMP profile. It works at the speeds indicated, but just that. No overclocking here. SS of CPU-Z.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: works well so far, and at less than half the cost of dell
customer_reviews.text: purchased a dell optiplex 3070 during the holiday deal cycle as I loved the form factor. however, the black friday deal i got only came with 8 gigs of ram. i like to have a lot of windows, programs, and browser tabs open all at once, so more ram was a huge need. i looked at many options, but this crucial kit seemed to be the one to try. 32gigs of ram was what i was looking for, compatible with the dell 3070, and at a price less than half of what it would've costed from dell. so far so good
customer_reviews.author: d808Top Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Good Ram / Dimm
customer_reviews.text: Great product, Well made / great quality. Shipment / delivery arrive on time. The moment it arrived I installed in my Dell XPS 8930 computer right away. Work great. What I don't like was it was shipped in a foam pad envelope instead of cardboard box Could be damaged from static electricity or shipment handling for this type of sensitive micro chips. I recommended this DRAM / DIMM 288 pins, 2666 MHz, 16 Gigabite ( 2 sticks 16GBx2) total memory 32Gigabite.
customer_reviews.author: K C

customer_reviews.title: Quality RAM Memory From A Reliable Manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I've had these two sticks of RAM for over a year now and haven't had any issues with them whatsoever. I upgraded from 12 GB of RAM to these 32 GB sticks. A very obvious and noticeable upgrade. Anyway, I've had good luck with Crucial products over the years, so I wasn't worried at all when I made this purchase. They're your basic, no frills sticks of RAM with no fancy heatspreaders/heatsinks attached to them. If fancy looking RAM is your thing, these are not for you. But if you want a nice, quality RAM memory upgrade for your PC, look no further. Definitely worth getting, especially if you can get a good deal for them.
customer_reviews.author: HiroNotHero

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade for our Dell
customer_reviews.text: Delivered fast, worked as expected. This was perfect and as expected On a somewhat related note: I Can't understand why computer manufactures skimp . My Dell had 4 slots with a max of 64 GB. It makes no sense to to come with an 8gb installed rather than a 16, even if it raises the CPU price by 30 or 40 bucks. I'd rather do that than end up pulling the 8gb it came with and tossing it, , but that has nothing to do with this item
customer_reviews.author: SurfCaster

customer_reviews.title: Added to a pc used for general use and some gaming
customer_reviews.text: Added these to a CyberPower pc that only had 8gb installed when purchased a few years ago. I have used Crucial to add memory to PC's for years and I have never had any issues. Crucial provides high quality at a competitive price. They also have on their website, and program that will identify the memory you need for your particular PC. I was glad to see Amazon carried these as the price was good and delivery is always quick. The performance increase when gaming on the PC is very noticeable. Prior to the added memory, the PC was sluggish when gaming. When I buy memory, I always look for Crucial memory first.
customer_reviews.author: Mindcrime

customer_reviews.title: Crucial Memory is pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: I got a new Windows 10 desktop computer recently & the first thing I did was get 16GB more of DDR4 memory for it and it makes this new Acer Desktop computer really work nice and fast. Not sure if it's good for gaming use as it's 16 GBs DDR4, but for regular computer use, it's really pretty good. I kept the 8GB of memory in my new desktop computer & just quickly add this Crucial 16GB memory stick onto the motherboard with no problems and it's a speedy little desktop computer now. No issues at all and a nice 5 star rate for this Crucial DDR4 16 GB memory stick.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey 440Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Why a 5 out of 5?
customer_reviews.text: This memory stick was great I added it to my pre-installed 8GB I now have 24gb running mode so I'm happy. Steps to install. power off computer. unplug your power cable to pc. get a screwdriver Phillips head or flat head or diamond star. open up the case look for the free slot next to something that looks similar to what you have in your hand push it in lock it down recover the case put the screws back in plug the power supply the power cord back in. Boot It Up☝
customer_reviews.author: PetaBytePete

customer_reviews.title: Worked well in a Dell Optiplex 3060
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to put in a Dell Optiplex 3060 small computer that had no ram. It worked great and the computer is back up and running again. It performs as well as I would expect it to. I didn't do any speed tests but windows is fast and programs load fast and don't crash so that is all that matters to me. It's in a computer that runs 24/7 as a mini server for various things and has been working flawlessly for me. Price was right as well. There were a few cheaper ones but this was the best deal for a trusted name brand at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Mac k.

customer_reviews.title: An easy upgrade for gaming computer
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded a HP system that came with 8GB of RAM to 16GB so the computer can play more PC game titles. I went to Crucial to check for compatible RAM modules before looking for the additional memory for my system. I took out the one stick of 8GB that came with the system and installed these 2 sticks of 8 to make 16GB as I didn't want to have mismatched speed or frequencies. I probably could have bought just one 8GB and just added it to the system. However some systems do better when the memory modules are of identical brand and specs.
customer_reviews.author: Ming

customer_reviews.title: Huge difference!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my 10 year old desktop to a new unit about 3 months ago. It had double the RAM at 8gb. Wow. Still, the speed was "iffy." It seemed like it was taking time to flip between tabs on a browser. I looked up the specs and the motherboard was upgradable to 32gb. So, I bought these 2 X 16gb cards. Very easy to install and I encountered no problems. The PC recognized the new RAM and required no additional configuration. What a phenomenal difference! Nothing waits any longer. It made a huge difference. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G. Gage

customer_reviews.title: Memory might be great, but not compatible w/ my Dell Vostro 3671 desktop bought new 4 months ago
customer_reviews.text: Listing in Amazon indicated this memory to be compatible, but computer wouldn't start with it installed - so I returned it. Crucial should be more careful with its compatibility listings. Unfortunately, it seems that Dell-approved memory costs twice as much, so for now, I will continue with the original 8 MB that came with the PC.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMatthew

customer_reviews.title: Causes i5 8400 2.8 to hang
customer_reviews.text: Home built pc with 2666 mhz 8 gig non-ecc DDR4 dim from Kingston. Bought this to match - yes it's rated for a higher speed, but the mobo simply reduces all the speeds to the slowest speed. Voltage is the same. End result - computer would very regularly hang. Especially when returning from sleep mode. Remove the Corsair dim - works great. Remove the Kingston and only use the Corsair - hangs. This went back and bought dims from Kingston.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow Fever "Mitch"

customer_reviews.title: Worked For Me
customer_reviews.text: Purchase a new HP desktop and wanted to increase the ram to 16GB. Looked my model up in the Crucial site and they pointed me to this model. Read the usual opinions that you could not mix different memory brands. etc. Well, logic tell me that if you purchase the exact memory and the only thing is the name of the manufacturer then is the same thing. Opened the desktop, installed the the memory. Voila, my new HP desktop now has 16GB of ram. Crucial had been around forever and this is definitely a great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Honestreview

customer_reviews.title: Crucial Memory had always been good to me
customer_reviews.text: I needed to increase the RAM in my Media PC in the Video room. After decades of updates with Crucial memory it was my first choice. The memory shipped quickly and was in pristine condition on arrival. It only took about 2 minutes to open the DELL Inspiron desktop unit and another 3 or so minutes to remove the 4GB memory board and install the 8GB memory board in its place. Booted up, Press F2 and check the BIOS for correct memory state. I have never had a memory board failure, luck ? or Crucial ?
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: I don't know what to make of it.
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked Crucial. They have a great reputation. They are manufactured by Micron which has been held to have the best QA around. I used the Memory Finder Tool on the Crucial website and it recommended this as a memory upgrade. They failed on two identical systems in the same way. See on the chart I supplied the S3 State with the 2, 7 Amber Blinking Pattern. It's indistinguishable as a memory error. I don't know what to make of it.
customer_reviews.author: Book Glutton

customer_reviews.title: One out of two worked.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these 32GB kits. Manufacturer (HP) says 4x 16GB DIMMs totaling 64GB should be fine. Crucial memory upgrade finder says these are compatible upgrades. One of the pairs worked fine and the other pair caused a "no boot" every time. I tried shifting them around between slots all different ways but nothing helped. I suppose the motherboard could somehow be the cause but far more likely in my opinion is one of the DIMMs is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive RAM and works great for my desktop.
customer_reviews.text: Crucial have always been a good value for the money. Installing the 2 sticks took less than 5 minutes Upon restart, I just had to confirm that new RAM have been installed and that was it, my desktop went from 8gb to 24gb. I did have to look at the computer specs (Dell XPS 8930) though to make sure I had them in the right order/sequence in the 4 slots before adding the sticks.
customer_reviews.author: K.D.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, transformed my computer.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new Dell and got only 4GB of RAM with it, I thought that might be enough. Boy was I wrong. Booting was slow, web pages ground to a halt and the hard drive ran constantly. I got this 8GB pack - everything on the internet told me that it was better to go with 2 sticks than one so I did. I've used Crucial before and they always worked OK. They popped right in. In case you've never done it, changing RAM is super simple. Instant transformation - faster booting, web pages fly by. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Good memory, cheaper than mfg. site, delivered 2 days early...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Crucial memory in builds and upgrades for years without problems. Install was uneventful. The vendor, Memorybank, specified a one week delivery window beginning six days from purchase. My memory arrived two days BEFORE the beginning of that window. Plus, the sticks cost $20 less than the Crucial site. Nothing at all to complain about here.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy duty creative and development work.
customer_reviews.text: I need a lot of RAM as I do some fairly hefty creative projects and I'm dipping into AI development a little. So I found these cards after looking for the best match for my motherboard. Soon after I purchased them I saw a review saying that their cards were full of errors, so I began to worry, but so far I haven't had any issues. No errors as far as I can tell, but I haven't done a full memtest yet, so perhaps I've just been lucky? These are great cards so far though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Crucial
customer_reviews.text: One of the most trusted brands that I've used for many years. I added this set to a Dell 5680 gaming PC that came with DDR 2400 installed. I removed that and added it to my old HP business desktop. I'm not sure how much difference DDR 2666 makes but there was no reason to buy more DDR 2400 when the Dell unit runs DDR 2666 without issues. Working fine for months now without memory errors or system issues.
customer_reviews.author: MKP

customer_reviews.title: Update BIOS, Plug and Play.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you update your BIOS, it comes with instructions that tell you this on the receipt, but double-check it. No hassle though, I built my computer from the tower on up and needed a twin RAM stick to go with my current setup. Suffice to say I'm excessively pleased thus far, and performance while gaming has improved.
customer_reviews.author: A Patriotic Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Failed to pass a test
customer_reviews.text: Memtest failed with “too many errors”. Looks like they are trying to sell the rather expensive memory without any testing (is it that hard to automate?). People who are not testing the received memory are prone to get randomly happening errors and reboots - the worst nightmare for a computer owner... Crucial! Please test your products before selling.
customer_reviews.author: Placid

customer_reviews.title: Works for HP 800 G2 MiniTower
customer_reviews.text: I put this 32GB kit (16GBx2 dual rank, 2666 MT/s) in the HP 800 G2 MiniTower and it works well. The speeds are a little faster than the stock 16 GB of RAM it came with. As for performance, Windows 10 and all of the overhead that is run with the system are now happy. I also run VMs on this system and the extra memory is helpful with this level of multitasking. I tested this initially with MemTest 86 and have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: RLewTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Died after 11 months
customer_reviews.text: Brought "Crucial" RAM for the first and last time. Installed and worked but burned out after just 11 months and not under intense conditions. I have never had this problem with other RAM purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fits my HP Pavilion which is listed for only 16gig max, 8gig per each slot. I think because it is dual channel it’s only using 1 channel per stick verse the full 32gig. Also, I think Windows 10 is using the rest for virtual memory. If I take one out it shows only 8gig physical and drops down my virtual... Then again I’m not a computer expert.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy.
customer_reviews.text: This is simple plug and play memory. Plug it in and let it work. No flashy-blinkies. Just memory. Crucial has been very reliable for me through the years. I would not recommend this for an overclocked system since there is no heat sink. But for a simple general purpose machine it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 16 gig ram for my new HP Envy Desktop Computer, Intel Core i7-9700 computer to bring it up to 32 gigs of ram. When I went to install it, the fit was really very tight in the slot. I wasn't sure it was the right chip. but after about 10 minutes of wiggling around, I got in. I restarted the computer, and it worked great. This desktop would be a pain to put anything in it. No room to get your hands into it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P

customer_reviews.title: Works good with asrock J4105M motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Runs ok at the rated speed and does a couple billion refresh cycles a minute stays energized for most of the day and no data corruption to bad no other storage media can come now where near to taking that kinda abuse after about 15 years i may do a update on this story * * * * * END OF STORY * * * * *
customer_reviews.author: patrick m leese

customer_reviews.title: Crucial never fail.
customer_reviews.text: Crucial doesnt need a way too long of a review. If they crucial of course they work. Its ram memory not rocket science, they do what they supposed to so. Use them on a plex server running server 2016 datacenter and so far not a single problem. UEFI recognize them fine even tried them on a mobo that requires overclock to reach speed as a test. Excellent ram.
customer_reviews.author: Sigfredo Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading an Inspiron 3470 is not an option. My mother's new PC was *crawling* on its included 4GB of memory so this stick and an SSD were all we needed to unlock pain free computing for her. Luckily, Dell PC's continue to be easy to work on. All you need are P-head screwdrivers.
customer_reviews.author: GoodEgg

customer_reviews.title: A Fair Price for 16GB of RAM
customer_reviews.text: Needed to get my gaming PC to 32 MB from 16. Found the supplier's web site. Very good instructions on how to find the right RAM for a particular model PC. Installed fairly easily (with these plug-ins you always need to be gentle and not force them in). I saw some reviews about this failing after some time. I've only had mine 3 weeks but so far no issues.
customer_reviews.author: GatorClay

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I added 2x8 dimms of the exact specs, but different manufacturer so that I now run 32 mb. All the RAM tests indicated that this is working well with my system. While I rarely need 32mb above 16mb, some of my applications are simply faster, and I have a bad habit of keeping too many Chrome tabs open, which sinks RAM like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my HP Pavilion 590
customer_reviews.text: My HP Pavilion 590 (backup computer) came with only a single 8GB memory module. I didn't really need more memory, but wanted it to operate in dual channel mode, so I bought this module to enable it. Installation was easy, for an HP, and the computer recognized the module on reboot. No problems at all, it just works.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Always great memory never settle for the cheap stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I always use crucial brand memory it has never let me down in over 20 years of using it. Work great right out of the box benchmarks look good. Computer is running nice and smooth I am so thankful that you have became a number one company for RAM that you could count on.
customer_reviews.author: NhscanDotCom

customer_reviews.title: Lightening Fast Processing!
customer_reviews.text: This did the trick for me. My HP desktop came with only 4Gig ram. One program needed 16Gigs. Every time I opened that program my computer would become sluggish and freeze, constantly. So irritating. Upgraded to 32 Gigs (2 16G sticks), problem solved! Just need to add a solid state drive now.
customer_reviews.author: James Williams

customer_reviews.title: Quality memory for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought multiple modules in the last couple months to run my mining rig and Crucial 8GB memory has been installed in every motherboard. I run this with Biostar TB250-BTC and TB250-BTC+ motherboard for Intel 1151 processor. I've yet to have a single issue with the rigs running 24/7 since February. While these memory have gone up in price, it seems to do its job and happy with the results. I've always been happy with memory made by Crucial and their price point so will continue to buy these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: AkiTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, immediately recognized by Dell3470 PC
customer_reviews.text: Added this to new Dell 3470 small PC. Arrived quickly with 1 day prime shipping! Followed the illustrated instructions in the PC service manual (although it was mostly obvious once the PC cover was off). Only problem was pushing the board into the socket, took some force. Reassembled and turned PC on and memory was immediately recognized. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: EdJ

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Yes it works, in my new Dell G5 5090. I took out the two 8 gb. I put 1, 16 bit. booted normal, I put in the 2nd, 16 bit. and i got a notes, that my Ram had changed, I hit continual. then the last two 16 bit. put the plug cord back in and again I got a Ram change, and hit continual. I checked my resales 64 bits of ram 63.9 usable. end resales no hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Addington

customer_reviews.title: Junk, not compatible with QNAP NAS
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it was "Guaranteed" work with the QNAP TS-1635AX-4G. However when tried the NAS would not boot up. Total scam. On top of it all Amazon charged me return shipping (in at an APO) and a restocking fee. HORRIBLE experience. I have no clue why Amazon feels they need to abuse those of use deployed overseas.
customer_reviews.author: Eric 'EZee' Zarnosky

customer_reviews.title: Great memory..
customer_reviews.text: Very fast next day delivery ! Oh, the ram is fast too ! Took 2 minutes to install... very easy ! Got plenty of memory that will allow many open windows and the speed to access them quickly ! More than enough memory for gaming !
customer_reviews.author: vb

customer_reviews.title: A cost-effective way to upgrade desktop PC performance
customer_reviews.text: the system for making sure you purchace the right memory for your specific system is very helpful. Ease of installation depends on the way your computer is designed. It was very easy with my Dell XPS. The price was favorable compared to having the computer assembled with additional RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Cactus Paul

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install. Works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to boost the RAM in my son's gaming PC from 8GB to 12GB - so I ordered one of these to plug into the empty RAM slot. Installed in seconds - rebooted the machine and WIN 10 recognized the extra RAM immediately. Went with Crucial memory since it's a name I recognize - and I wasn't disappointed. The price was good, too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Good value memory
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade the RAM in my Dell XPS8900 i7-6700 and chose the Crucial 2x8GB paired sticks based on the company's reputation for quality at a decent price. After a couple of questions, their tech advisors were able to direct me to the correct product.. The installation was simple and the memory performs as expected. PROS Price Performance as advertised Tech support from manufacturer CONS None
customer_reviews.author: Jim Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great value RAM that works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have much to say regarding this RAM - except that it was easy to install (more a thumbs-up for my computer than the RAM) and it works exactly as advertised. Not blazing fast - but allows me to work in "DaVinci Resolve" without any hiccups or complete shutdowns. And that is exactly what my PC needed - a little boost. Well worth the cost for the peace of mind that I can run the applications I need to - without having to restart my PC. When I am ready to upgrade again, I will go with Crucial!
customer_reviews.author: Kit Baty

customer_reviews.title: Does work for alienware Aurora R8
customer_reviews.text: Usually your supposed to use the same ram not mix and match but for now it works, I added this to the stock 16gig ram that comes in my R8 and it shows up as 32gig works great no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Smith

customer_reviews.title: Luck of draw from Crucial
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I ordered Crucial RAM. Ordered a set of two 16G Ram, but one 16G SIMM is defective. If both are in working condition, I would not hesitate to give it 5-star rating. Requested for a replacement. When replacement is received and both 16G RAM SIMM are in working condition, I am willing to change rating to 5.
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: Easy upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Recommended a pc for a client that came with 8 gb stick, and concurrently ordered this to bump total to 16 gb, now running in dual channel. Crucial may not sell the fanciest ram in the world, but my experience with their ram and ssds are “they just work”. Also, crucial website is very good at informing you what ram and ssd you can buy to upgrade a specific system.
customer_reviews.author: SoFlaWill

customer_reviews.title: The perfect upgrade for my HP Pavilion
customer_reviews.text: I have an HP Pavilion 690-0020, which shipped with 8 GB RAM but two of that was allocated to the integrated graphics. I could barely play Star Wars Battlefront II on low settings. I ordered this stick of RAM, and now I'm playing at much higher settings with no issues. It was super easy to install!
customer_reviews.author: Projectno253

customer_reviews.title: Module was defective straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these 8Gb modules to install in my Dell XPS 8930 but one of them was defective. I was very surprised about that knowing that Crucial is supposed to be a very good brand. It may have been damaged in shipping. It is very poorly packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with Alienware Aurora R7
customer_reviews.text: Went from 16 to 32 GB. Worked like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: SteppingStone01

customer_reviews.title: Good memory without fancy heatsink
customer_reviews.text: It is kind of a norm now for DIY people to get memories with fancy heatsinks. Since I have an Alienware aurora r7, the opaque side cover will not allow me to see the light effects of those fancy heatsinks. I would rather go for this kind of normal crucial memories to save some money.
customer_reviews.author: Yingjie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Ram, however did not arrive on time
customer_reviews.text: I needed to beef up a new PC and decided to go with 32GB of this ram. This really did increase performance which I needed and I would give this product 5 stars if the product arrived on time as advertised. Since the Christmas holiday Amazon has had a hard time getting my orders delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff J

customer_reviews.title: Delivered great. Installed easily. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered at my door early. Installed easily in Lenovo small form factor desktop. Shows up in Windows just fine. Computer a lot less sluggish due to running out of memory. Crucial web site and memory find tool ... got me a link to buy on Amazon and order worked out just great.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Spicer

customer_reviews.title: Ok. check chipset compatibility.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure your mother board supports these ram chips. Mine did not and I had to flash the bios every time I turned my computer on or it would not boot up. Other than that these were great. I have now upgraded to corsair ram.
customer_reviews.author: Spenser Plueard

customer_reviews.title: BEST UPGRADE FOR DELL XPS 8930 TOWER
customer_reviews.text: i am a second year mechanical engineering student and i needed to upgrade my dell desktop to handle the software i used on the daily basis and decided to go from 16gb ram to 32gb ram. crucial ram was the perfect solution to my problem and i noticed a major performance difference because when i was running 16gb ram, fusion360 would often freeze on me and since going to 32gb ram, i could run bigger projects in fusion360 and other computer aided engineering software i used. i also bought the cruical ssd for my boot drive and my computer runs a lot faster now since the upgrade
customer_reviews.author: constantino

customer_reviews.title: Fits Dell Alienware Aurora R7
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for Dell Alienware Aurora R7. Kept the two factory 8GB modules installed, so I have 48GB now.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jesky

customer_reviews.title: Dell OptiPlex 3070 Memory
customer_reviews.text: This will work for the Dell OptiPlex 3070. Cheap and effective way to double the RAM
customer_reviews.author: InfiniteReality

customer_reviews.title: Works in Dell XPS 8920
customer_reviews.text: Worked in XPS8920. I added these to the existing 16GB (8GBx2). When the system reboots the first time it goes into the BIOS and recognizes the newmemory.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Dell compatible
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Crucial site has this listed as compatible for my make, model. Dell does special things with the BIOS sometimes, or there are issues with space inside the case with other memory with the heat sinks. This worked with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Neubauer

customer_reviews.title: Playing Nicely!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased and installed into my Dell XPS 8930, which came with a single 8 Gb stick of memory and so far it is playing nicely with the stock memory. No issues to this point and the system seems much more responsive. Very pleased and I will probably purchase more. Update, went ahead and purchased 2 more sticks for a total of 32 GB in my Dell XPS 8930 and it's all playing nice with the stock memory. I did use the Crucial website to evaluate my system and suggest the proper memory. So far there have been no issues. Very Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Culpepper

customer_reviews.title: Does the Trick.  Wait for your price!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great right away. Inserted easily. It was the best of a bad lot of choices price-wise. (Paid $166). Shipping took forever, and I mean months. This is a commodity item, so though I recommend this, I also recommend that you buy any well-trusted name (like Crucial, for example) with price as your primary guide.
customer_reviews.author: SuperCourier

customer_reviews.title: Worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Installed in an HP 290 to upgrade the RAM for a work desktop (now that working remotely from home is a thing for many people) and had no issues at all. Reported in the BIOS properly, and Windows 10 had no issues adjusting to the new amount of RAM.
customer_reviews.author: A_DT

customer_reviews.title: Works in a Dell 3670 Desktop
customer_reviews.text: I used this memory to add another 8GB to a Dell 3670 desktop. Worked perfectly well with the OEM memory already installed. I have been using Crucial memory for years and I have always been satisfied with their performance. I tend to go with stability over speed and these do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: M. Saxon

customer_reviews.title: Adding memory is easy
customer_reviews.text: The dell model I wanted for other reasons only came with 4 gb, so it was paging by the time I loaded the browser. No a few minutes later, the memory is almost never full. (Check for memory speed and available slots in TaskManager on Windows 10. The larger memory stick may have to be in the first slot.)
customer_reviews.author: Jed3

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Memory
customer_reviews.text: So far I've bought crucial memory upgrades for both my laptop and desktop and haven't had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: dw10

customer_reviews.title: HP 690-0073w compaitble upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Installed in an HP pavilion 690-0073w that shipped with 8gb, popped in the crucial 8gb stick, powered it back on and Zoom Zoom baby! Didnt need to anything else, ram was automatically recognized and performance boost was immediately noticeable. Easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN CORSAIR
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought three pairs of 2x8gb DDR4 RAM from Corsair and two of them were defective, causing blue screens and crashes and getting tons of errors when I used Memtest. I had to try another brand and these ones work flawlessly and with 0 errors in a 12 hour test.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: HP OMEN 870-224
customer_reviews.text: Booted up really easy on my HP OMEN 870-224 Wanted to run warzone better and this completely helped my setup. No more fps drops and keep a steady 80fps with normal and some high settings
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Easy upgrade for better performance
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my desktop for a quick upgrade on the cheap cheap. Took a whole 2 minutes to open it, get it in, and close it again. Everyone should be able to do this, and should do it for there pc, anddd your laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good ram, compatible with Dell optiplex desktops
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to upgrade and parallelize computing processes on my desktop. Fully compatible with a Dell optiplex 7060 small form factor. Used as a Linux box for phylogenetic analysis work.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Works great in QNAP TS-x77
customer_reviews.text: Was a little concerned that there might be issues with this memory working in new QNAP TS-x77 (Ryzen). Decided to give a go considering that QNAP approved memory cost almost double. Well, nothing to worry here. It works great. Memory recognized and I have zero issues. I went with 2 16Gb single sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Remo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !
customer_reviews.text: High quality product. I highly recommend the Crucial.com website. You download a quick scanner, and will tell you exactly what products are compatible with your computer. No guesswork, no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know much about PC Ram before purchasing these. Now that I do, I found out the reason my pc was not running as smoothly as I thought It should was because the pair was not working as a pair and only one would run on Windows. So the pair totally 16 GB was only able to be used as 8 GB. Just missed the return window. Try another Ram stick brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Clark

customer_reviews.title: Nice DDR4 Dimm Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I put this 16-GB memory into a Dell 3671, and it installed perfectly. Windows 10 saw the change without problems. This Dimm has impressive spec's, e.g., dual rank, at a reasonable and from a major company, Crucial. Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Quality memory
customer_reviews.text: I've always had good luck with products from Crucial and their memory has always been top notch for my purposes. This was cheaper on Amazon than the Crucial site, not sure why but it installed easily, was recognized immediately and made my setup noticeably faster.
customer_reviews.author: tom4416

customer_reviews.title: This product functions as it should
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to upgrade my desktop from 2x8GB [16 GB total] to 2x16GB [32GB total] (I only have 2 memory slots). The upgrade using Crucial RAM was pretty smooth. This 32 GB RAM works very well with my computer, and multitasking has become twice as easy. Just make sure to do your research and buy RAM that's compatible with your computer. Thankfully, the Crucial website helps you find RAM that's compatible with your computer.
customer_reviews.author: e666z

customer_reviews.title: Additional memory
customer_reviews.text: My computer had gotten very slow. Even after tuning it up, it was still super slow so I installed additional memory. It was easy to do, and fixed my problem. Highly recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good RAM
customer_reviews.text: Built a PC for kids, used this RAM, so far it works great.
customer_reviews.author: AY

customer_reviews.title: Good Build and works great
customer_reviews.text: Budget, faster RAM for my TC-865-UR15 desktop from Acer Aspire series. It works so flawlessly that I am glad I did not pay $100 extra with more 8 gb RAM instead I upgraded myself.
customer_reviews.author: Sandip

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple product
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Recognized immediately by the system and able to take full advantage of my new 16GB of total RAM.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Promise kept
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing much to say about this. It works great and hasn't given me any hard time in the last couple of months I have been using it in my desktop computer. Never tried overclocking it though, as it meets all my requirements the way it is.
customer_reviews.author: sneak_pigeon

customer_reviews.title: Picture Shows PC Memory, Description States PC Memory, but They Shipped Laptop Memory
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to buy. I went to Crucial, looked up my memory, clicked the link to come over to Amazon and order it. I read through the description first, checked the pix, everything looked great. Instead of getting what's advertised here, I got laptop memory that's half the size of what's described here. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Amazon Buyer of Things

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly in my Dell Inspiron 3671 to increase my total memory from 8GB to 16GB. I will recommend to buy this RAM. Shipping was super fast by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ejaz

customer_reviews.title: Great, but packaging makes me worry.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, works well enough. My only beef is they sent it in a pathetic little envelope which could've EASILY damaged the product if whoever handled it happened to be a little careless. Send it in a box at the very least, damn.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade for budget gaming/workstations.
customer_reviews.text: Not the fastest ddr4 you can get but a good value, 2666MHz, CL19.
customer_reviews.author: GoBroncos

customer_reviews.title: Fits HP ENVY desktop computers
customer_reviews.text: I replaced 12gb with 32 gb using this pair, and my desktop is running faster than before. Very well priced, and it is worthwhile to install them when you are on windows 10 operating system.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Installed easily
customer_reviews.text: no problems. Passed long form testing. Working as expected. The thumb rule is if it doesn't fail in the first month, its gonna last. I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Memory increased helped
customer_reviews.text: My DELL was sluggish, I had to improve the memory to get a boost for its performance, this Memory upgrade did help. I am thinking of updating the drive to SSD, which should provide some further relief.
customer_reviews.author: Vijay V

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my new low budget gaming rig. A dirt cheap i5-9400 with a 6GB GTX 1660ti but only 8GB of RAM. These dropped right in with zero problems and now have 32GB and my system is just purring along.
customer_reviews.author: DangFineGuy

customer_reviews.title: Crucial -- Excellent, as Always
customer_reviews.text: Just the addition my computer needed. The seller responded privately to my questions regarding the memory's compatibility and verified that this was the correct purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyTom

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST RAM COMPANY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this RAM for my pc build and while i was waiting on the rest of my parts I checked if I had all the right parts. My RAM was labeled as DDR4 ram which my motherboard takes but while I was trying to install the RAM I had reliased that they had sent me DDR3L RAM instead of DDR4 so now I have to wait on however long it takes for a new ram to ship.VERY DISAPOINTED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great deal! This is already my second order
customer_reviews.text: Works on our Lenovo Think Station! I was ordering a new think station and saw the price with 32GB RAM was very high. So, I decided to order the Think Station with the minimum 8GB RAM, and ordered 32GB kit from Amazon. So this gave me total 40GB and still cost much less than ordering everything from Lenovo. Great deal! This is already my second order.
customer_reviews.author: XTWO

product_meta.title: Crucial 16GB Kit (8GBx2) DDR4 2666 MT/s (PC4-21300) SR X8 DIMM 288-Pin Memory - CT2K8G4DFS8266
product_meta.description: CT2K8G4DFS8266 is a 16GB Kit consisting of (2) 8GB single Ranked DDR4 desktop modules that operates at speeds up to 2666 MT/s and has a CL19 latency. It is an Unbuffered DIMM. It conforms to the industry standard DDR4 ECC UDIMM layout of 288 pins and is compatible with systems that take DDR4 2666MT/s UDIMM memory.
feature_bullets: Speeds up to 3200 MT/s and faster data rates are expected to be available as DDR4 technology matures
Increase bandwidth by up to 32%. Voltage - 1.2V
Reduce power consumption by up to 40%
Faster bursts access speeds for improved sequential data throughout
Optimized for next Generation processors and platforms

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars270 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
